Denise Welch has opened up about her mental breakdown, saying it's the kind of thing that can see people become homeless. 
The actress has always been very frank about the problems she's faced in the past, including depression and alcohol addiction. 
The 58-year-old star spoke about her struggles at an event for homeless charity Centrepoint. 
The mum-of-two told Best magazine that people can end up on the streets as a result of the kind of "mental breakdown" she had, and that we're all just a few steps away from losing everything. Read More Denise Welch furiously hits back at claims her marriage to artist Lincoln Townley could be over Denise with sons Louis and Matt (Photo: Rex) 
She said: "But for many homeless people, their breakdowns are untreated, and their lives fall apart... It can happen to anybody." 
The Geordie actress is starring in an upcoming short film - alongside son Louis Healy, 16 - based on her own illness. 
In Black Eyed Susan, Louis plays a teenage boy which tries to drive a women (played by his mum) to suicide. 
Denise has also penned a novel, called If They Could See Me Now, about a woman trapped in an unhappy marriage that seems perfect to others on the outside. Matt made Denise super proud at the Brits 
Earlier this month, the actress, who is married to artist Lincoln Townley, revealed that her most recent mental collapse had happened just two months earlier, and lasted for three days. 
It's something she thinks of as 'the terrible blackness'. 
She said: "I no longer compound my illness with alcohol - I won that battle five years ago - but I still have episodes." Read More Denise Welch admits son Matt Healy's song is about her postnatal depression and cocaine use Denise is married to artist Lincoln Townley (Photo: Splash News) 
The depression began for Denise after the birth of her eldest son Matt Healy, 27, who recently made her 'shake and cry with pride' when his band The 1975 were named Best British Band at the Brit Awards. 
Denise, who used to be married to fellow Geordie actor Tim Healy, added: "I never resented Matthew, but all I wanted to do was sit in my dressing gown and have somebody give me an injection to make everything go away." 
The star stays strong with the help of husband Lincoln, whose career as an artist is flourishing. Like us on Facebook
